## Computed() function

Create a Computed service factory.

Computeds are derived values that automatically track their dependencies and recompute lazily when those dependencies change.

\*\*Most users should use the preset instead:\*\*

```ts
import { createSignals } from '@lattice/signals/presets/core';
const { computed } = createSignals();
```

**Signature:**

```typescript
Computed: (args_0?: ComputedOptions | undefined) =>
  import('@lattice/lattice').Service<ComputedFactory, ComputedDeps>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

</th><th>

Type

</th><th>

Description

</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

args_0

</td><td>

[ComputedOptions](../computedoptions/) \| undefined

</td><td>

_(Optional)_

</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

import("@lattice/lattice").[Service](../../lattice/service/)<!-- -->&lt;[ComputedFactory](../computedfactory/)<!-- -->, ComputedDeps&gt;

## Example 1

Basic derived value

```ts
const { signal, computed } = createSignals();

const firstName = signal('Alice');
const lastName = signal('Smith');
const fullName = computed(() => `${firstName()} ${lastName()}`);

fullName(); // 'Alice Smith'
lastName('Jones');
fullName(); // 'Alice Jones' (recomputed)
fullName(); // 'Alice Jones' (cached)
```

## Example 2

Diamond dependencies

```ts
//      A
//     / \
//    B   C
//     \ /
//      D
const a = signal(1);
const b = computed(() => a() * 2);
const c = computed(() => a() * 3);
const d = computed(() => b() + c());

d(); // 5 (each node computed once)
```

## Example 3

Dynamic dependencies

```ts
const showDetails = signal(false);
const summary = signal('Short');
const details = signal('Long description...');

// Dependencies change based on condition
const display = computed(() => (showDetails() ? details() : summary()));
```
